messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] A different view... oshigata
messages.msgSnippet: Well, his drawing techniques for the blade wouldn t help the rendering of the nakago.  If anything, keeping the representation of the nakago consistent with
messages.messageBody:
Well, his drawing techniques for the blade wouldn't help the rendering of the nakago. If anything, keeping the representation of the nakago consistent with the way the blade is drawn would probably result in a strange looking oshigata. Maybe it's just easier to just avoid the problem.

Jim

Still, you would think it
would include an oshigata of the signture for the signed pieces. I think it
is a bit ambiguous.

Gordon

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
